cause.description:
On March 6, 2007, Judge Reggie Walton convicted Libby on four of the five counts against him—two counts of perjury, one count of obstructing justice in a grand jury investigation, and one of the two counts of making false statements to federal investigators—and acquitted him on one count of making false statements
On June 5, 2007, Libby was sentenced to thirty months in prison and fined $250,000
On June 14th 2007, Judge Walton "ordered" Libby "to report to prison while his attorneys appeal his perjury and obstruction.
1. Give Lewis Libby the true benefits of our justice system not a vicious assault from an immoral judge and federal prosecutor
2. Pursue a Presidential Pardon for Lewis Libby
3. Pursue a charge of prosecutorial misconduct for the real criminals: Patrick Fitzgerald and Reggie Walton
cause.mission: Stop the injustice that put Lewis "Scooter" Libby behind bars
cause.name: Free Scooter Libby
